intro: Babiana papyracea, commonly known as the paper lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble lilies. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive, papery texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Babiana papyracea is also cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
